meanings.definition: Without the use of gloves or other hand coverings.
meanings.sent1: She picked up the hot pan with her barehands.
meanings.sent2: He preferred to work on the car barehands.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked the entire meal barehands, much to the surprise of the guests.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the masterpiece barehands, feeling every brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The gardener tended to the delicate flowers barehands, ensuring no harm came to them.

meanings.definition: To handle or manipulate objects with one's hands only.
meanings.sent1: He barehands the dough to create the perfect shape.
meanings.sent2: She carefully barehands the fragile glass ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The magician barehands the cards, impressing the audience with his skill.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic barehands the engine, fixing it with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor barehands the clay, shaping it into a beautiful sculpture.
